content:
• Tuesday, August 6, 2013

  • Nikkei falls on strong yen, regional shares weak

    • The Nikkei tumbles 2.3% as the USD/JPY touches a six-week low. The yen is 0.42% firmer against the greenback to ¥97.33. The market will get a fresh BOJ policy statement on Thursday.
    • Meanwhile, stocks in Hong Kong, Sidney, and Seoul fall 0.4%, 1%, and 0.8% respectively. The Shanghai Composite is flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 PM
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks off AH following First Solar's Q2 miss

    • Solar stocks, many of which have seen enormous 2013 gains, finished AH trading down moderately after First Solar missed Q2 estimates (the company blamed solar project sale push-outs) and lowered its 2013 guidance.
    • SPWR -2.6% AH. SCTY -2%. SUNE -1.2%. LDK -2.6%. CSIQ -2.4%. JKS -2.2%. STP -2.2%. JASO -2.8%. TSL -2.7%. YGE -3.4%. SOL -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • NSPH

    More on Nanosphere earnings

    • Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) Q2 comes in mixed, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue.
    • Net losses narrowed as revenue continued to strengthen.
    • Total sales jumped 38% Y/Y, driven by sales of its Verigene gram-positive blood culture test.
    • The company recorded 35 new customer placements and a 3.1% decline in total costs and expenses.
    • It lowered its full-year revenue and customer placements guidance however, now projecting FY13 revenue of $10M to $11M and 150 to 200 customer placements. That number is down from its May view of $13M to $15M in revenue and 200 to 250 customer placements.
    • Company says it remains on track for its gram-negative blood stream infection panel and enteric panel set for submission to the FDA in Q3 and Q413, respectively.
    • Shares -21% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 PM
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere beats by $0.01, revenue misses

    • Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH): Q2 loss of $0.14 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $1.9M, misses by $200K. (PR)
    • Shares -21% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy drops AH on Q2 revenue miss, downside guidance

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) -8.1% AH after slightly missing its Q2 revenue number and issuing downside guidance for Q3 revenue, seeing $59M-$63M vs. $76.3M consensus estimate.
    • ENPH blames the forecast in part on an anticipated reduction in inventory levels within its distribution channel due to the transition from the third to the fourth generation microinverter system.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM
  • EBIX

    Ebix partly rebounds after response to money laundering report

    • Ebix (EBIX -7.5%) wound up erasing over half its intraday losses.  An official response provided by the company regarding a Bloomberg report (I, II) about an FBI money laundering investigation may have helped. Ebix reiterates its claim that money laundering allegations made against it are "false, inaccurate and likely to cause significant financial harm to Ebix shareholders."
    • Ebix criticized Bloomberg in a similar manner back in Nov. '12, in response to a report about an SEC accounting probe. Six months later, it was learned the SEC's probe had been upgraded to a formal investigation.
    • The U.S. Attorney's Office in Atlanta has not yet commented on the situation.
    • Ebix has faced numerous accusations regarding its accounting practices. SA contributor Sunil Shah argues media coverage (including Bloomberg's) has been hyperbolic.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • EOG

    More on EOG Resources' Q2 results

    • EOG's Q2 crude oil and condensate revenue, its largest revenue contributor, rose 46% Y/Y on a 35% production increase.
    • Natural gas liquids revenue gained 19%, while natural gas revenue added 29%.
    • Raises its FY 2013 crude oil production growth target to 35% from 28%, and raises its overall company production growth target to 7.5% from 4%.
    • Total NGL production is expected to rise 14% from the previous 10% target; natural gas production is projected to fall 11.5% during 2013.
    • Shares +4.2% AH. (Q2 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • Z

    Zillow raises guidance, investors sell on the news

    • Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) guides on its Q2 CC for Q3 revenue of $49.5M-$50.5M, above a $48.6M consensus.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $186M-$188M, above prior guidance of $178M-$182M and a consensus of $183.3M. 2013 adjusted EBITDA guidance is unchanged at $20M.
    • Shares -9% AH following a 224% YTD gain and a 23% gain just since Trulia (TRLA - shares -2.7% AH) reported last week.
    • Zillow's aggressive spending is responsible for the Q2 EPS miss and unchanged adjusted EBITDA guidance. Sales/marketing spend +172% Y/Y to $32.9M and up to 70% of revenue. R&D +91% to $11.1M.
    • Marketplace revenue (78% of total) +86% Y/Y in Q2 vs. +87% in Q1. Display revenue (ads) +29% vs. +27%. Within Marketplace, real estate revenue +80% to $30.6M, mortgage revenue +126% to $5.8M.
    • 61M monthly unique users in July, +66% Y/Y vs. +63% in April. Mobile visits up nearly 2x Y/Y, 321M homes viewed on mobile vs. 241M in Q1. 60% of Zillow visits on mobile vs. 55% in Q1.
    • Premier Agent subs rose by 4,777 in Q2 to 38,807 (+14% Q/Q and +71% Y/Y). Average revenue/sub of $266 vs. $263 in Q1 and $259 a year ago.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar comes off halt, shares +21.5% AH; Cisco, Juniper tick higher

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is making new 52-week highs after raising its FQ1 guidance well above consensus.
    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) +0.5% AH and Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) +0.8%. Finisar's remarks about seeing "increased sales of 10G, 40G and 100G Ethernet transceivers for datacom applications" could bode well for Cisco's FQ4 data center switch sales (results arrive on Aug. 14). Cisco, believed to have ~2/3 of the 10G switch market, has already been seeing strong data center switch demand. Campus switch demand has been softer.
    • Finisar's full FQ1 results are due on Sep. 5.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • PXLW

    Pixelworks misses by $0.09, misses on revenues

    • Pixelworks (NASDAQ:PXLW): Q2 EPS of -$0.23 misses by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $9.6M (+15.5% Y/Y) misses by $1.4M. Shares +28.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile -9.4% AH due to guidance; revenue recognition policy changed

    • Glu (NASDAQ:GLUU) is now accounting for sales on "digital storefronts" (e.g. the App Store, Google Play) on a gross, rather than net, basis. This means Apple/Google's 30% cut is now included in revenue figures.
    • Glu has restated past results to reflect this accounting change. It's also reflected in the company's revenue guidance.
    • Using the new method, non-GAAP Q2 revenue (exc. $1.2M deferred revenue increase) was $23.2M (-22% Y/Y). "Platform commissions, royalties, and other" amounted to $7.7M.
    • Glu expects Q3 revenue of $19.6M-$21M and EPS of -$0.10; the consensus (based on older method) is at $21.8M and -$0.03.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $96.8M-$98.9M and EPS of -$0.22 to -$0.24; consensus (old method) is at $84.4M and -$0.13. The guidance implies strong Q4 growth.
    • Glu says its guidance "reflects an adjusted launch schedule."
    • Q2 operating cash flow was -$1.9M vs. $1.6M a year ago. Gross margin was 69%, -500 bps Y/Y. 2013 gross margin guidance is at 68%.
    • Opex -16% Y/Y to $21.6M; R&D spend -29% to $11.2M.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    •  Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PXLW +26%. UVE +17%. SNTS +7%. LYV +6%. CSC +6%.
      Top losers: SYNC -16%. NSPH -15%. GLUU -9%. CAR -8%. FSLR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • TPLM

    Triangle Petroleum acquires Williston properties, funds via 15M-share offering

    • Triangle Petroleum (NYSEMKT:TPLM) agrees to acquire Williston Basin properties currently producing ~1,150 boe/day for a combination of ~$103M in cash, acreage and 325K common shares.
    • The deal will be funded through a public offering of 15M common shares; proceeds also will be used toward TPLM's drilling and development program, and for general corporate purposes including working capital.
    • Raises FY 2014 capex budget to $430M-$465M from previous $245M.
    • Shares -6.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar raises FQ1 guidance, shares halted

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) expects FQ1 (July quarter) revenue of $266M and EPS of $0.30-$0.31, above guidance of $245M-$260M and $0.22-$0.26, and a consensus of $253.6M and $0.24.
    • The optical component vendor mostly attributes its performance to "increased sales of 10G, 40G and 100G Ethernet transceivers for datacom applications." Demand for 10G data center hardware and 100G carrier optical networking gear has been growing rapidly. Telecom sales rose by $2M Q/Q.
    • Though Finisar is halted, other industry names are up in AH trading. JDSU +4.4%. CIEN +2.8%. Other names that might rally in sympathy: INFN, NPTN, AFOP, OPLK, OCLR.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • DVA

    DaVita stronger after hours

    • DaVita HealthCare Partners (NYSE:DVA) rises 1.21% AH after posting Q2 results.
    • Total U.S. dialysis treatments for Q2 were 5,867,973 — treatments rose 7.6% Y/Y on a per day basis.
    • FY13 consolidated operating income guidance is raised to $1.83-1.93B. The company also lifts the bottom end of its full year consolidated operating cash flow outlook to $1.4B from $1.35B. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences raises guidance, shares +5.6% AH

    • Computer Sciences' (CSC) FY14 (ends March '14) EPS guidance range has been raised by $0.20 to $3.50-$3.70, largely above a consensus of $3.52.
    • FQ1 EPS boosted by restructuring moves. Cost of services -17% Y/Y vs. an 11% Y/Y revenue drop.
    • Free cash flow was still -$9M, though that's better than the year-ago period's -$25M. EBIT margin was 7.4%, up from just 2% a year ago.
    • Cash/equivalents stood at $1.93B at quarter's end.
    • $127M spent on buybacks.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD announces 5M share buyback at $34 per share

    • WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) announces plans to initiate a tender offer to repurchase up to 5M shares (10% of shares outstanding) at a price of $34/share in the next week.
    • Shares up 2.3% AH to $33.90.
    • Previous: Icahn-backed WebMD director resigns
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • MDSO

    Medidata Solutions announces $200M private placement; gives up gains

    • Medidata (MDSO -7.9%) is giving up some of the prior week's gains after the company announces it will offer up to $200M in convertible senior notes maturing in 2018 with an additional 30-day option for up to $30M in over-allotment.
    • The company is giving up ground after investors drove shares up 18.7% on July 25th following a solid Q2 beat.
    • Medidata plans to use the proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, including complementary acquisitions and/or investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries profit falls 18% but results beat expectations

    • CF Industries' (NYSE:CF) Q2 earnings fell 18% Y/Y, hurt by weaker revenues and margins and negative derivative impacts, but results were better than expected; shares +2.5% AH.
    • Sales in the nitrogen segment, CF's biggest by revenue, rose 1% amid stronger volume due to timing differences between application seasons in 2012 and 2013; phosphate sales fell 18% amid lower volume and pricing.
    • Realized prices rose Y/Y for major nitrogen products other than urea, as CF had built a strong order book, especially for ammonia and urea ammonium nitrate; urea prices fell due to more U.S. imports and delays in application seasons globally.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUAN

    Nuance provides light FQ4 guidance, shares now -6.1% AH

    • In prepared remarks, Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) guides for FQ4 revenue of $470M-$500M and EPS of $0.24-$0.32, below a consensus of $519.8M and $0.38.
    • The company blames its shift to recurring/subscription-based revenue streams, which leads to lower up-front sales. Mobile/consumer is singled out as an area where the shift "has the effect of elongating revenue."
    • FQ3 healthcare sales +2% Y/Y (boosted by acquisitions), even with FQ2; division made up 55% of segment profit. Mobile/consumer sales slumped: revenue -19% vs. -2%. Enterprise improved: revenue +7% vs. -20% in FQ2. Imaging -4% vs. -10%.
    • Healthcare transcription sales still weak, Clintegrity and Dragon Medical stronger. 1.8B cloud mobile/consumer transactions in FQ3, +80% Y/Y. Enterprise lifted by demand for Nina voice assistant apps.
    • Deferred revenue balance (stems from subscriptions/recurring revenue) was $396.5M, +2% Q/Q and +32% Y/Y. Operating cash flow was $85.5M vs. $141.5M a year ago.
    • $115M spent on buybacks.
    • FQ3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • VSAT

    ViaSat beats by $0.10

    • ViaSat (NASDAQ:VSAT): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $321.1M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $21.62M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz slumps after earnings miss, guidance raised

    • Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) trades down 3.6% AH as Q2 results miss estimates.
    • Net sales of Xyrem and Erwinaze rise 50% and 36% Y/Y respectively.
    • Psychiatry Products sales fall 40% from Q2 2012 on generic competition.
    • A rise in the cost of sales and SG&A lead to a 54% increase in operating expenses. (PR)
    • FY13 outlook: Xyrem net sales, $560-570M (up from $540-555); Erwinaze/Erwinase net sales, $170-180M (up from $150-175M); revenue, $860-880M (up from $830-860M); adjusted EPS, $6.20-6.40 (up from $6.10-6.30).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • LYV

    Live Nation beats by $0.19, beats on revenues

    • Live Nation (NYSE:LYV): Q2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.19.
    • Revenue of $1.68B (+8.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.06B. Shares +6.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • FST

    Forest Oil beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Forest Oil (NYSE:FST): Q2 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $116.8M misses by $3.33M. Shares +4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • Z

    Zillow beats on revenue, misses on bottom line

    • Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q2 EPS of -$0.30 misses by $0.19.
    • Revenue of $46.9M beats by $2.5M.
    • Earnings call at 5 ET to include FY13 business outlook.
    • Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • OKE

    ONEOK Partners announces 10M share offering, shares -4%

    • ONEOK Partners (OKS) -4.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common units.
    • OKS plans to use proceeds from the offering for general partnership purposes and to pay down debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • MDT

    Given Imaging beats by $0.02, beats on revenues

    • Given Imaging (GIVN): Q2 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $49.5M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $1.27M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • FURX

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals misses by $0.76, misses on revenues

    • Furiex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FURX): Q2 EPS of -$2.32 misses by $0.76.
    • Revenue of $3.0M misses by $8.94M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy beats, shares rise

    • SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $512.99M beats by $77.9M. (PR)
    • Shares +2.25% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus misses by $0.09, revenue misses

    • Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS): Q2 EPS loss of $0.55 misses by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $5.5M misses by $5.2M. (PR)
    • Shares -2.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNTS

    Santarus beats by $0.14, beats on revenue

    • Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS): Q2 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.14.
    • Revenue of $89.4M (+89% Y/Y) beats by $6.5M. Shares +7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar EPS misses by $0.13, revenue misses, guidance lowered

    • First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q2 EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $519.8M (-46% Y/Y) misses by $201.3M.
    • Expects 2013 revenue of $3.6B-$3.8B, worse than prior guidance of $3.6B-$4B and consensus of $3.83B.
    • Expects 2013 EPS of $3.50-$4.00, below consensus of $4.14.
    • Shares -3.4% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharma misses by $0.08, misses on revenues

    • Jazz Pharma (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q2 EPS of $1.43 misses by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $208.25M misses by $0.46M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • AMGN

    Amgen to raise bid for Onyx

    • Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) will reportedly raise its bid for Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) to $130 from $120.
    • Update 4:20: ONXX now fractionally lower AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance EPS beats by $0.02, revenue beats by $3.2M, shares up

    • Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN): FQ3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $490.8M (+9.5% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M.
    • Shares +3.6% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources up sharply after Q2 profit, Horn River progress

    • Quicksilver Resources (KWK +7.2%) powers higher after swinging to a Q2 profit from the year-ago period that included a $1.2B write-down, as even production revenue declined.
    • Q3 expected average production volume is 275M-280M cfe/day; FY 2013 average production volume continues to be expected at 290M-300M cfe/day.
    • KWK also reported some progress on the monetization of its Horn River Basin assets, as it moved the JV process forward into the formal bidding stage.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • RIO

    Three bidders for Rio Tinto's Canada sale reportedly drop out

    • Three bidders for Rio Tinto's (RIO -1.6%) majority stake in Iron Ore Co. of Canada, including Apollo (NYSE:APO), Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF), have dropped out after second round bids were due last month, Reuters reports.
    • Teck (TCK) is said to be one of two remaining bidders for the stake.
    • The low offers, at a time when dozens of mining assets are for sale and demand for steelmaking commodities is uncertain, raise questions over the future of a sale that could still take months to tie up should Rio decide to push ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENB

    Spectra rejects Sandell's call for asset sale or spinoff

    • Spectra Energy (SE -1.6%) rejects calls from activist shareholder Sandell to sell or spin off its western Canadian pipelines or its stake in DCP Midstream (DPM); selling shares in the Canadian unit would create tax problems and DCP’s rising cash flow will boost SE’s stock price, CEO Greg Ebel says.
    • Sandell said last month it considered a sale of assets to the partnership - which SE valued today at ~$9.68B - about a third of its plan for Spectra.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CRTX

    Cornerstone Therapeutics gains on Q2 earnings beat

    • Cornerstone Therapeutics (CRTX +4.2%) moves higher on a solid Q2, reporting earnings of $0.19 per share and beating consensus estimates of $0.12.
    • Revenues were $40.4M, up 88% Y/Y and above the analyst estimate of $35.79M. In the same period last year, the company reported $0.17 loss per share on revenues of $21.5M.
    • Gross margin of 75%, compared to 59% in Q212, primarily due to the addition of CARDENE I.V., as well as growth in net product sales resulting from price increases and lower estimated rates for certain sales allowances.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • URALL

    Fertilizer stocks surge on rumor of Uralkali rejoining potash cartel

    • Fertilizer stocks, especially potash stocks, surged following a rumor that Uralkali (OTC:URALL) is considering rejoining the potash cartel it destroyed last week.
    • Intrepid Potash (IPI -3.9%) spiked more than other fertilizer stocks because it's the only U.S. potash pure-play, Briefing.com reported; IPI had dropped 45% since the close on July 29.
    • Mosaic (MOS -1.7%), Potash (POT -0.2%) and Agrium (AGU -1.6%) all jumped on the news before settling back; CF Industries (CF -1.6%) also rose ahead of its earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNLPF

    Silver mining ETFs sink amid lame Fresnillo results

    • It's worse for the sliver miners than the gold miners today after Fresnillo (OTCPK:FNLPF -5.6%) reported a 61% decline in H1 profit and investors decide 2.6x book value and a 26.4 PE ratio is too expensive with silver (SLV -0.9%) slipping below $20 per ounce.
    • Fresnillo makes up 12% of the Global X Silver Miners ETF (SIL -6.3%) and 5.5% of the iShares MSCI Global Silver Miners ETF (SLVP -3.1%), but isn't a top-weighted stock in the PureFunds ISE Junior Silver ETF (SILJ -6.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras says oil output trend heading upward

    • Petrobras (PBR -1.9%) says it is boosting crude oil output as new platforms enter production, after platform shutdowns and falling productivity at mature fields in the Campos Basin that produces more than 85% of Brazil's crude has undercut output so far in 2013.
    • PBR also says it is starting talks with potential partners for the pre-salt concession auction set for October; under new production-sharing agreements, PBR is obligated to hold at least a 30% operating stake at the Libra field up for bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • CLBS

    NeoStem trades up again today off its switch to NASDAQ; names new Chief Medical Officer

    • NeoStem (NBS +6.7%) trades up again today after the cellular therapy company switched to the NASDAQ Stock Market from the NYSE yesterday.
    • Additionally, it's also named Dr. Douglas W. Losordo as its chief medical officer.
    • Dr. Losordo most recently was vice president of New Therapies Development, Regenerative Medicine and Baxter Ventures at Baxter International.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • FBNIQ

    Furniture Brands International plunges on Q2 report

    • Furniture Brands International (FBN -38%) took $26.9M in impairment charges related to software and trade name assets during Q2, leading the company to post an operating loss of $43.2M.
    • CEO Ralph Scozzafava says FBN's financial performance for the period was "below expectations." The company will now "engage outside advisors" to assist in a "thorough strategic review" aimed at "achieving further cost reductions, pursuing asset sales, and modifying credit facilities." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • HF

    EPA flexibility positive for refining sector, Wells Fargo says

    • The EPA makes clear in its ruling on renewable fuels that the market has reached certain barriers to greater consumption of ethanol, and that it will make adjustments to the mandated volumes of biofuel (including ethanol) in 2014, which should support a more normal market for H2 2013 and 2014, Wells Fargo says. (EPA document)
    • The news removes a major barrier to investing in the refining sector, the firm believes, calling it a clear positive for HollyFrontier (HF +1.4%), PBF Energy (PBF +9.7%), Valero (VLO +4%) and Alon USA (ALJ +0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy cut at two firms following widening Q2 loss

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS -2.4%) is downgraded to Neutral at both Citigroup and Howard Weil after posting a wider Q2 loss as hefty expenses related to a failed well more than offset higher oil and gas revenue.
    • Weil revisits the timeline for upcoming catalysts and sees a quarter's worth of time until the potential realization of value, so investors can stand on the sidelines for a bit before re-entering.
    • While expectations for the Jubilee field's 2013 exit rate volumes are to exceed 120M boe/day, Weil thinks investors have a "show-me" mentality after similar forecasts for two years running.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • VOLC

    Volcano posts a positive Q2, Canaccord ups the shares to Buy

    • Volcano (VOLC +9.8%) extends yesterday's post-session gains after the medical equipment manufacturer's Q2 report topped estimates.
    • The company affirms its FY13 EPS of 0.03 to $0.05, in-line with the Street view looking for $0.05.
    • Revenue is projected in a range of $394M to $400M, also bracketing consensus of $395.8M.
    • Canaccord ups the shares to Buy on the back of the report, saying that improving trends in its core IVUS business, plus easing Y/Y comps, strong margin expansion potential and several other catalysts on the horizon point to a more favorable risk/reward profile at current trading levels.
    • Shares are moving on nearly four times 30-day average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • CPRI

    Goldman doesn't think the market loves Michael Kors enough

    • Goldman's Lindsay Drucker Mann is excited about shares of Michael Kors (KORS +3.7%) following the red-hot retailer's FQ1 beat.
    • "Risk reward is compelling as valuation does not reflect the EPS runway," Mann says, adding that "positive conversion and double-digit traffic stands out in the context of weak retailer trends in 2Q."

  • PBF

    EPA sets renewable fuel targets

    • The EPA formally tells refiners to blend 16.55B gallons of renewable fuels to blend into the U.S. gasoline supply this year, and pares some targets the oil industry had criticized as too ambitious.
    • Refiners must blend 1.28B gal. of biomass-based diesel and 2.75B gal. of advanced biofuels this year, along with 6M gal. of cellulosic biofuels made from non-edible plant parts - far less than the 14M target the EPA proposed in February but short of the oil industry’s push for the category to be zeroed out completely.
    • After some initial reaction, most related stocks have returned to pre-announcement levels: PBF +8.6%, VLO +3.3%, HFC +2%, BIOF +1.8%, PEIX -4%, GPRE -3.2%, REX -6.6%, SYNM -4.3%, REGI -0.3%.

  • FRO

    Tanker rate slump signals retreat in U.S. oil imports; Frontline seen suffering

    • The biggest slump in tanker rates since January is signaling weaker U.S. oil imports and spurring analysts to predict a 15-year low for shares of Frontline (FRO -1.9%).
    • Rates for the biggest crude carriers sank 68% in the past two weeks, more than reversing their advance since the end of June; the rise is seen as a blip, as the U.S. meets the highest share of its own energy needs in three decades.
    • Rates for VLCCs, each hauling 2M barrels, fell to $7,954/day on Aug. 2 after rising as high as $24,493 on July 12; earnings last exceeded the $25.5K that FRO says it needs to break even in November.
    • While U.S. oil production is bearish for crude tankers, it’s boosting demand for ships to export refined products, chemicals and liquefied petroleum gas; Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG) is expected to benefit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 4 Comments
